alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Johnston; Wake; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 7:47PM EDT until July 09 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Harnett, Johnston, Wake, Wayne and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 747 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Goldsboro, Smithfield, Lillington, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Clayton, Dunn, Angier, Benson, Fremont, Walnut Creek, Apex, Holly Springs, Micro, Selma, Erwin, Coats and Four Oaks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
